p: The overactive immune response to sepsis, including monokine “cytokine storm” results from over activated M1 macrophages in response to tissue damage [ 115]. The response to sepsis is similar between old and younger patients. However, the mortality is much higher in older patients [ 116]. The difference is related to the dysregulated immune systems of the elderly. The elderly are unable to turn down the over-activated monocyte response, leading to disease progression, while regulatory mechanisms in the young counter-act and prevent the consequences of monocyte over-activation.
